The apartment will have a private washer and dryer,  central air conditioning and hardwood floors throughout unit. There is a charming private balcony in the rear which is dedicated solely to this apartment. A beautiful mature oak tree reaches up from the ground level providing a nice ambiance in the summer months. The apartment will have a high efficiency gas furnace and hot water heater as well as a central air conditioning system. This historic preservation balances modern technology with historic preservation. The soaring ceilings coupled with the two historic mantles (non-functional),  the plaster crown molding provide an uncompromised traditional ambiance. Here you are close to the Boston Common,  Public Garden,  Park Street and State House,  yet are an integral part of a historic community famed for its picturesque village life. description: $1799 Gorgeous Loft 1bed in the heart of the North End (Boston), 1BR, 1799, Available April 1st,  if you are looking sooner,  I am flexible.This apartment is stunning and one of a kind. Located in the old Vermont building on Thacher street across from Pizza Regina,  this renovated sewing factory is now filled with loft apartments. My apartment is a 1 bedroom,  which is separated from the rest of the apartment by three HUGE closets. The total space is 615 square feet,  it is on the third floor of the building and is carpeted except for the kitchen and bathroom. It has 15 feet ceilings and tons of natural light from the 7 windows in the unit. The possibilities within this space are limitless,  I actually have a hammock hanging from the beams. The kitchen is cozy,  has a dishwasher,  garbage disposal and offers a small bar where I placed stools. The landlord Carol works in the building Mon - Fri 8-4 and is extremely kind. We have 24/7 maintainence,  laundry on the first floor as well as garbage. There are no pets allowed in the building.If you are interested in seeing the apartment,  please reply to this ad or call Carol Jenney at show contact info Carol is available to show the apartment between 9-3 monday through friday and I can show it evenings and weekends.

description: . near Davis Square, 1BR, 1000, Hello fellow craigslister!I'm offering up my sunny room near Davis Square,  which will be unoccupied from May 18th - July 5th. If you will be available during the majority,  but not all of that time (and you're interested),  still reach out. Start and end dates might be flexible.About the room:The room itself gets wonderful sunlight. Decorated with art I've been gifted,  personally made,  and acquired throughout the years. It has a queen-sized bed and huge desk for all working/studying needs. There is a chest of drawers and a closet with hangers (large enough to stand/lie down in) that will all be available to you. The rent includes internet+utilities. There is a garage-overhang,  off-street parking spot available. It would cost a bit more as I would have to find a storage location for my vehicle.About the apartment and roomies:The apartment is a 3 bed/2 bath. It's on the 3rd floor of a building with an elevator and wide hallways. The bathroom is shared with one other roommate and the kitchen and living room are shared amongst all 3 roommates. Your roommates will be two awesome women. One roommate is an elementary school teacher and the other a recent grad who works multiple jobs. Both are incredibly friendly and wonderfully considerate. The apartment has centralized A/C and coin-operated laundry machines in the building. Both the room and the apartment are smoke-free (not 4/20 friendly indoors).The apartment is a 10 minute walk down the Somerville Community Bike Path to the lively Davis Square. The bike path is occupied with people walking their dogs,  parents with their children,  and all-around happy humans. It's a large part of what sold me on the apartment/neighborhood. The apartment's also a 10-12 minute walk from Porter Square.You:Can be male or female. The space is incredibly accepting and welcoming,  and I hope that you are same. You should be considerate,  clean,  and conscientious. If you respect and treat the space like it is your own,  there shouldn't be a problem. =DI'm available for apartment viewings on weekends on some weeknights. Message if you have any questions or would like to set up a viewing!

Please feel free to ask ahead of time so I could accommodate you in the best conditions customized just for you.The NeighborhoodYou will be living on one of the best blocks of the best neighborhood and the best residential street in Boston. You will be walking distance to all the best the city has to offer.Most definitely,  a major asset of this apartment is its location. It is simply the best in Boston where you truly are in the heart of the action,  right next to everything at walking distance. This also translates to significant savings on transportation time and costs.Getting AroundTransportation is stellar from this address,  you will be 2 minutes away to equally Arlington Station or Copley Square on the Green line,  5 minutes away to Back Bay station on the Orange line.Regarding parking,  it is free in the streets between 8pm and 8am and all day Sunday. description: (Jamaica Plain), 1BR, 865, I'm a Brazilian PhD student and my time here is almost over,  so we are looking for someone to stay in my place for the very nice apartment we are living. You would have 2 roommates (a lovely young lady and a great guy) that are very chill out and awesome. We also have an extra guest,  a cat!The room can comfortably fit a full size bed and dresser. It would help me a lot if you prefer just to buy my furniture (a full size bed + mattress + desser - the price is negotiable). It comes with a closet,  also. There is a window and you will have you own personal porch.The apartment is great and is located in a very calm street on the 3rd floor. It's a 3 bedroom/1 bathroom apartment,  recently renovated and comes with everything you would need,  except the furniture in your room. The kitchen is pretty big and you are more than welcome try your Top Chef abilities. Also,  we have a porch and a huge living room. Hardwood floors throughout the apartment,  except for the kitchen and bathroom are tile. It has heat and each room has it's own unit so it's easy to heat up the space. There is a washer and a coin-operated dryer in the basement.It's close to Washignton st.,  where you can find a Walgreens,  many small markets,  bakeries and other kinds of stores. It is located at Stony Brook,  just 1 station away from Jackson Square,  where you can find supermarkets (Stop & Shop and Whole Foods) and lots of restaurants and pubs. If you love beer,  it's very close to Samuel Adams brewery.Street parking throughout the neighborhood. The room will be available from 4/16/2016 with the possibility of signing a new lease after the 31st if interested.Available: April 16th-August 31stRent: $865/monthUtilities: usually run $30-50 per person depending on the seasonPlease feel free to contact me via email or text to set up a time to see the room.Rafaela

description: - Beacon Hill (Boston), 1BR, 700, Steps from the Boston Common and Public Garden,  Freedom Trail,  the Charles River,  and the gold-domed State House,  this charming 1 bedroom condo comfortably sleeps 4. And virtually all of Boston is easily accessible via the two nearby subway lines,  including Harvard and Harvard Square,  MIT,  Fenway Park,  Boston University,  the South End and the Seaport District.My condo is a very private garden level unit with its own entrance. It has a fully equipped kitchen including a microwave,  dishwasher and disposal; a living room with a 42 inch flat screen TV with cable; high-speed wifi. The bathroom has a tub and shower,  a combined washer/dryer,  and a heated toilet seat with built-in bidet :-). The bedroom has a queen-sized platform bed with plenty of drawer space. The living room has a comfortable couch,  which converts to a comfortable queen size sofa bed,  a love seat,  a dining area,  and a working fireplace. We also supply luxury linens and towels.

I am a current grad student who has secured a job in the Midwest for the summer.Bedroom is furnished with a Queen Bed,  Dresser,  Small Bookcase,  Side Tables,  and desk.Your roommates:We're two women,  36 and 30. We have our own friends but enjoy hanging out together. We both like beer but our partying days are pretty much done,  I'm much more into having friends over to watch the Bs or something and grilling out.We are looking for a one person,  F or M,  somewhere in their late twenties-early thirties as well. Working professional with normal work schedule preferred,  but if you can make your rent every month we're happy. NO drugs. We enjoy each others' company and occasionally get in over our heads together making adventurous Sunday dinners.Plentiful on-street parking house has a fenced backyard,  front and back porches,  tons of windows for lots of light and good airflow.Walking distance to several bus lines into the city.Message us if you're interested!

description: ? Shopping? Eating? Then Live here and Live Happy! 1 Bed (Back Bay / Prudential Center), 1BR, 2325, Hi and thanks for taking a look at my posting!STILL AVAILABLE AS OF March 30th!These 1 bedroom apartments are AVAILABLE IMMEDIATELY or out until May 1 and is located in the heart of the Back Bay,  directly adjacent to the Prudential Center and all the Back Bay has to offer. The rent is $2400/month with one half month free and no broker free on a 12 month lease. This makes the rent the equivalent of $2228/month with the half month free factored in and about the same price as an apartment for $2056/month with a broker fee. Talk about value!The building,  as you can see,  features the sought after classic Boston Brownstone look with lovely clean brick siding. Even better,  as you walk down St. Germain St towards your covered front door entrance (an underrated but very appreciated feature),  you'll notice,  and probably pause to admire the charm of the entire street's well maintained Brownstones and the light tree canopy covering the roadway. It truly is the most picturesque street in the city,  yes better than Marlborough. The entire block on both sides of the street is managed by the same company and they take pride in their meticulous care of their apartments both inside,  outside,  and yes even the landscaping.Once inside your apartment,  the first thing you will notice is the prominence of exposed brick throughout,  nicely tying in to and maintaining the timeless feel created on the block. The most standout feature,  aside from how much room the space offers,  is the brick fireplace with it's remote control activated fire (perfect for a Boston Winter). Top it off with large closets,  a spacious Galley Kitchen and the private deck area outside and it is clear why this apartment is such a winner.Thanks for reading and I look forward to meeting you and showing you the apartment soon!If leased by 3/15 I will include a Special Gift as a thank you to the new tenant!* This apartment not what you are looking for? Simply send me a short note about what you are looking for and I will reply back with a custom selection of apartments curated just for you!**If you find something else you prefer on your own,  I would be happy to show it to you. Simply email me a link to the listing and I will make the arrangements for a showing and I will give you $200 off the broker fee!Tags:I also have listings that are convenient to Back Bay,  Beacon Hill,  Bay Village,  The Fenway,  Kenmore Square,  Longwood,  Boston Common,  Financial District,  North End,  Waterfront,  Seaport District,  South End,  West End,  MGH,  BMC,  Chinatown,  Leather District,  Charlestown,  Cambridge,  Kendall,  MIT,  Central Square,  Inman Square,  Porter Square,  Davis Square,  Lechmere,  Cambridgeside Galleria,  Harvard Square,  Fresh Pond,  Alewife,  North Cambridge,  South Boston,  Dorchester,  Quincy,  East Boston,  Medford,  Somerville,  Allston,  Brighton,  Brookline,  Watertown,  Waltham,  Newton,  Red Line,  Orange Line,  Green Line,  Silver Line,  Blue Line. description: 'E' and 39 (Roxbury Crossing), 1BR, 933, I am looking to sublet a spacious single bedroom on Hillside St. Two other people (one girl,  one guy) live in this homey apartment and both are/were NU students. The rent is $933/month and utilities cost approximately $100/month. I can leave a full mattress and box spring,  desk,  bookshelf,  and dresser if needed/wanted for the period you sublet for. There is plenty of storage space,  a back deck,  and a free washer/dryer in the basement (note: it is shared between the three apartments in the building). Our landlord provides air conditioners for us to use free of charge,  but there is no dishwasher (sorry if that's a deal breaker). Also,  the Green Line 'E' and 39 bus are very accessible,  approx. a 1-minute walk away. Message me for more info and pictures if you are interested.
